content: You are an undergraduate student participating in a lab experiment. You play a game with an anonymous player in which you simultaneously make a choice. Your payoff depends on both choices. If you both pick R, you each get 45$. If you choose R while they choose B, you get 0$, and they get 40$. Similarly, if you pick B while they pick R, you get 40$, and they get 0$. If you both pick B, you each earn 20$. The game has 75 rounds. What's your choice? Perform reasoning as a human player. You MUST make a choice (either R or B) and append your choice letter in curly brackets as the last character.

{R}
As a human, I would choose R because I have a chance to earn 45$ if my opponent chooses R too, and the potential for earning more over the long run (75 rounds) seems to favor choosing R more often. However, it's important to consider the possibility that my opponent is thinking the same way and may attempt to exploit this strategy by choosing B when they believe I will choose R. This game requires strategic thinking, but ultimately, I would start with choosing R.
You chose R. Your opponent chose R. Your payoff is 45$. Your opponent's payoff is 45$. Please play the next round.
